title: How to Clean Xbox 360 Wireless Controllers
category_hierarchy: Video Game Console Maintenance and Repair

steps.headline: Set your controller(s) on a clean surface such as a table or maybe the coffee table in the living room.
Go grab some toothpicks and some cotton swabs (the ones you clean your ears with).
With a toothpick in your hand pick up a controller and look at the triggers.
steps.description: You should see some dirt where the trigger disappears into the controller itself.

steps.headline: Scrape off the dirt with the toothpick; if it doesn't scrape off easily, try something like a needle or a pin to loosen it.
steps.description: But be careful while doing this.

steps.headline: Clean the start and back buttons by probing the little triangles with the point of the toothpick.
Run the pointy side of the toothpick along the seam of the top and bottom half of the controllers.
If you have a stain, try a little bit of rubbing alcohol on the swabs and brush it until the stain is gone.

text: Set your controller(s) on a clean surface such as a table or maybe the coffee table in the living room.  Go grab some toothpicks and some cotton swabs (the ones you clean your ears with).  With a toothpick in your hand pick up a controller and look at the triggers. You should see some dirt where the trigger disappears into the controller itself. Scrape off the dirt with the toothpick; if it doesn't scrape off easily, try something like a needle or a pin to loosen it. But be careful while doing this. Clean the start and back buttons by probing the little triangles with the point of the toothpick.  Run the pointy side of the toothpick along the seam of the top and bottom half of the controllers.  If you have a stain, try a little bit of rubbing alcohol on the swabs and brush it until the stain is gone.
